bio.p: Dr Pavlin is a medical epidemiologist with the Communicable Disease Surveillance and Response unit of the World Health Organizationâ€™s Office of the South Pacific. He specializes in the epidemiology and control of emerging infectious diseases and those prone to causing epidemics, particularly viral hemorrhagic fevers and other serious zoonoses. The research for this manuscript was conducted while he was specializing in preventive medicine at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, Baltimore, MD, USA.
